DN0059-d-01-21-90-BN.Narrative: TRAIN CREW ALLEGES WHILE PROCEEDING DOWN 1.25 GRADE IN DYNAMIC BRAKE, TRAILING TRUCK UTLX 80048, DERAILED WITH 13 OTHER CARS AT E. VERONA, AND SIDESWIPED 6 CARS ON SIDE TRACK.INTERVIEW WITH ENTIRE TRAIN CREW REVEALED NO IRREGULARITIES. SPEED TAPES REVEALED PROPER TRAIN HANDLING. TRACK INSPECTION PRECEEDING DERAILMENT REVEALED WHEEL MARK ON TOP OF RAIL FOR SHORT DISTANCE, THEN ON TIES FOR SOME DISTANCE TO DERAILMENT SITE. INSPECTED CARS REVEALED NO NOTICEABLE MECHANICAL DEFECTS. RECHECK OF TRACKREVEALED ACCEPTABLE GAGE, BUT CROSSLEVEL 1/2 INCH LOW ON LOW SIDE OF CURVE. THE CROSSLEVEL WAS THE PREDOMINANT SOURCE OF CAUSE. CONTRIBUTING WAS THE FACT THIS TRAIN WAS 6900 FT LONG AND WAS IN 4 DIFFERENT CURVES AT THE TIME OF ACCIDENT, ON A DESCENDING GRADE WITH DYNAMIC BRAKING IN EFFECT. MAKE-UP OF TRAIN CAUSED LEAD WHEEL ON REAR SET OF TRUCKS OF EMPTY CAR BN 531909 TO DERAIL. CONDUCTOR INDICATED THE TRAIN HAD SEVERAL SEVERE RUN-INS OF SLACK BETWEEN GILLETTE AND THE POINT OF DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
